page.title: 12Churches at Heather
page.content: The Church holds together past village history and Christian mission today. It was founded as a Chapel for the Knights of St.John, who held the Manor and lands of Heather and had a Preceptory there from about the time of Henry II, 1154-1189, until the dissolution of the Order of the Knights of St.John, 1535. Four out of five Rectors of Heather were Priors of the Hospital of St.John from 1220-1301. Coats of Arms in stained glass windows link Heather with Knights of the old Order and the re-founded Order of St. John in England. Arms of the Prior of Clerkenwell link a former Preceptory to the Priory of Clerkenwell, now the H.Q. of the Knights of St. John and the St. John Ambulance Brigade, and their flags hang in the Church.
